nodes.bodyText: typo: adit
there's a lot of duplication between the two queryStrings.  What can we reuse?
Yeah...I'm trying not to get too fancy here without using a real DSL for query building. However, it's easy enough to split out the select statement, timestamp checks, and limit.
is this the only one that was added?  looks like it
yes I believe so. When alphabetizing, you exchange a one-time ugly diff for better merge management in the future and easier-to-find items.
any idea what this comment meant?

I originally wrote it, and at the time I was fighting with the user provider and understanding how the scopes work. In particular, you can shoot yourself in the foot if you manage to use a provider outside of its intended scope, and it's also possible to confuse the administrator deleting the user with the user being deleted if you're not careful.
It doesn't add any clarity anymore though so I nixed it.
The fully constructed username would be better here
update the comments in workbench-api.yaml to match the new name
Please check our constellation of googledocs for references to this value.

nodes.bodyText:
what if these objects don't have a common ID or don't have a common event time?
It seems that this is an important assumption/requirement for your use case, so maybe it should be enforced along with the non-empty condition.
oh it's cause you're grouping by action ID.  ok then.

I thought about doing that. Initially these were private methods, but then everything seemed to fit better on the mapper, but I don't believe it's possible to create a private helper method on a mapper.
Technically, they could have different event times due to an upstream bug, but I don't feel like it's appropriate to enforce that here. Maybe a cron to scan the BQ dataset now and then for sanity would suffice there.
typo

@@ -7435,3 +7518,72 @@ definitions:
           Type of target. Described by the enum TargetType (which is not generated). Left as string
           since BigQuery doesn't enforce the enum membership.
         type: string
+  AuditAction:
+    type: object
+    description: >
+      A user or system action in the audit system. May contain multiple agents, targets, and action
+      types.
+    properties:
+      actionId:
+        description: Unique ID for this action. Used for grouping similar events under a
+          single action, though in this representation we're returning a straight list of rows.
+          This is technically a UUID, but this may change in the future (to a shorter random string),
+          so we only type it as a String.
+        type: string
+      actionTime:
+        description: Time of the earliest event (row) for this action.
+        type: string
+        format: date-time
+      eventBundles:
+        type: array
+        items:
+          "$ref": "#/definitions/AuditEventBundle"
+  AuditEventBundle:
+    description: >
+      Composite header for an AuditAction's sub-actions. Useful as a map key, plus it contains
+      information about the agent, target, and action type (of which there can be multiplpe per
